name: EntryType
documentation:
Enumerates the supported types of values that can appear in a {@link Document} entry.

These types provide a normalized internal representation of different JSON-compatible values, allowing for efficient indexing, filtering, and serialization within the Fluxzero document store.

Supported Types

  • {@link #TEXT} – textual content, including strings and non-numeric identifiers
  • {@link #NUMERIC} – numeric values such as integers, floats, or decimals
  • {@link #BOOLEAN} – boolean values: {@code true} or {@code false}
  • {@link #NULL} – explicitly null entries (i.e., JSON {@code null})
  • {@link #EMPTY_ARRAY} – empty arrays (e.g. {@code []})
  • {@link #EMPTY_OBJECT} – empty objects (e.g. {@code {}})

Each entry type can be serialized into a compact {@code byte} identifier for efficient wire transfer or storage. Use {@link #serialize()} and {@link #deserialize(byte)} to convert between enum instances and their byte representation. @see Document.Entry @see Document

methods.name: deserialize
serialize
methods.documentation:
Serializes this entry type to a single byte.

Useful for compact storage or transmission over the wire. @return byte value representing this type

enumConstants.name: BOOLEAN
enumConstants.documentation: Represents boolean values: {@code true} or {@code false}.

enumConstants.name: NUMERIC
enumConstants.documentation: Represents numeric values including integers and decimals (e.g., {@code 42}, {@code 3.14}).

enumConstants.name: TEXT
enumConstants.documentation: Represents textual values such as plain strings (e.g., {@code "hello"}).
